raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are extracting factual relations from a medical imaging lecture. Use only information grounded in the input SLIDE_TEXT.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
As you can see from our course schedule, today’s topic is Optical Imaging, listed here as Lecture 23. This is our final imaging modality in the sequence, coming right after the ultrasound sessions.  This lecture will connect what we’ve learned about other imaging techniques to the world of light-based imaging.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Output a triple only if both subject and object appear verbatim in SLIDE_TEXT (case-insensitive).
- Predicates must be one of: uses | via | represents | depends_on | measures | produces | reconstructs_with.
- Add modalities ["text"] by default; add "image" only if clearly visible without the text.
- Confidence in [0,1].

OUTPUT:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"<verbatim subject>", "p":"uses|via|represents|depends_on|measures|produces|reconstructs_with",
     "o":"<verbatim object>", "modalities":["text","image"], "confidence":0.0, "evidence":"<short quote from SLIDE_TEXT>"}
  ]
}

assistant
{
  "triples": [
    {
      "s": "Optical Imaging",
      "p": "represents",
      "o": "the world of light-based imaging",
      "modalities": [
        "text",
        "image"
      ],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "This lecture will connect what we’ve learned about other imaging techniques to the world of light-based imaging."
    }
  ]
}

triples.evidence: This lecture will connect what we've learned about other imaging techniques to the world of light-based imaging.
